Posts.Title: Had Stereotactic Biopsy Today pennysue64 Germanlady

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2008 08:52AM pennysue64 wrote: I guess that is what has me a little more nervous is the fact that she said she wanted both my husband and I to come to the visit today.  Maybe that is just her normal procedure but of course I am reading into it.  Unfortunately, I have inherited my mother's trait of "worrying".  I just can't seem to shut it off!  So what treatments have you gone through since your diagnosis?  Can you think of any specific questions I should ask today?  Thanks again!
Posts.Title: Had Stereotactic Biopsy Today pennysue64 Germanlady

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2008 11:19AM pennysue64 wrote: Well, we're heading out - the weather is awful and its snowing really hard.  They did call and said they wouldn't have biopsy results until around 2 so they moved my appt. to 2:30 - Wish me LUCK!
Posts.Title: Had Stereotactic Biopsy Today pennysue64 Germanlady

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2008 04:26PM pennysue64 wrote: It's B9 - I cried like a baby when she told us - I have sclerosing adenosis - not sure if I spelled that right.  She said that she does want to do a follow up in 6 months and a year and if there are any other changes we will do an open surgical biopsy and remove the entire area - she said this is benign but it is still something she wants to keep a close eye on. Thank you everyone for your prayers and wonderful advice.  Oh yes, she did take me off the premarin permanently.  I can live with the night sweats! Thanks again
Posts.Title: Had Stereotactic Biopsy Today pennysue64 Germanlady

Posts.Content: pennysue64 wrote: Well, its done - It ended up taking about 2 1/2 hours.  They didn't know for awhile if they were going to be able to do it because the area was so close to the chest wall.  Once my surgeon got there and they repositioned me a bit they were able to proceed with the test.  I did have some valium in an iv, the first couple of numbing shots burned a bit but wasn't bad at all - All in all it wasn't near as bad as I was expecting.  Laying there for so long was a little uncomfortable - My surgeon said she wasn't able to get all of it but they did get alot.  I am scheduled to go back in on Thursday and get my results.  I did have a lot of bleeding afterward and they had to change my bandages a couple of times but it seems to be fine now - I'm doing the icepacks and hoping to get a good nights rest.  Thank you everyone for your thoughts and prayers - I will keep you posted after my appointment Thursday! Thanks again! Penny Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Had Stereotactic Biopsy Today pennysue64 Germanlady

Posts.Content: pennysue64 wrote: I am home and had GREAT news!  The biopsy came back b9 - she said I have sclerosing adenosis and she wants to watch it closely.  6 month mammo and one year.  She told me if there any further changes we will do an open biopsy and remove the entire area.  Hubby and I are so relieved!  We are celebrating with my 16 year old daugther - I hadn't realized just how worried she was for me and I was for her - This sight has been wonderful!  It was bitter sweet as we left the dr's office - we saw a cousin of my husbands in the waiting room.  I was rejoicing over my results and she was there to schedule her mastectomy after finding out this week she has BC.  I felt guilty for my good news and her bad.  I told her about this site and told her everyone was so wonderful and they would help her through this stressful time. Thank you all for your words of comfort, wisdom and advice.  While I hope I don't have to come back here to seek advice or comfort again, I will definately return to see how everyone else is doing!  I wish you all the best!  You are a wonderful group of women! Hugs to All! Penny Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy is B9 pennysue64 27andworried

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2008 05:33PM pennysue64 wrote: Silver: I had the stereotactic biopsy done a week ago today.  I was pretty nervous about it but it all went well and my results came back benign - thank goodness.  My procedure did take a little longer because several of my microcalcifications were close to the chest wall so it took them awhile to get the original positions.  They actually gave me an iv of valium to help relax me and I was thankful for that.  I do have a lump in my breast now where it is still swollen some and I bled for awhile so they said the lump could take several months to go away - the staff was wonderful and they told me step by step everything that was going on - Good Luck - I will keep you in my prayers for good results.
